instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after CPU replacement. Funny problem.
threads.message:
Hello guys, I am working on a Macbook air 2017 Logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with 1.8Ghz cpu.

The board came with Vcore shorted. I decided to replaced the CPU (cpu taken from other board) and the board boot, see wifi, but will not boot into MacOS or boot in Recovery. It start to load then turn off. 

However, The laptop boot up fine in Ubuntu and works nicely. I can run and complete Ubuntu on the local disk.

I decided to replaced the CPU again (taken from donors board) and same problem :)

I have also replaced CPU from a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and it has same problem.  

It seems apple don't want us to replaced CPU. 

I have no ideas what the problem now.

Both laptop work very well with Ubuntu. 

Sebastien

threads.title: Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after CPU replacement. Funny problem.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Clean ME region in BIOS...

threads.title: Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after CPU replacement. Funny problem.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 75313, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Clean ME region in BIOS...
[/QUOTE]



Hello,

Thanks.

I have done ME region and NVRAM reset.

It start with apple logo, show progress bar then after 2min there nothing on the display, only backlight is on and it turn off. (during all this process power supply showing 540 - 600 amps.

Of course Ubuntu boot in 55 seconds :geek:

Sebastien

Regarding 840-00840-A that I mentioned in my first post.

After CPU replacement, I flash this attached bios and it will get stuck on apple progress bar. If I boot in safe mode. It boot completely.

When I login on MacOS. I get this message about IGPU. See attached 

Maybe graphic is not working correctly. I have no ideas 

Even with clean ME region it does same.
